title.narrative: Women's Rights and Religious Tolerance in Indonesia

description.narrative: The Danish Government allocated 8,2 mil. DKK to strengthening women´s rights and religious tolerance in Indonesia as part of the Denmark's Freedom Initiative. The program is a complementary support to Component A of the MRD3 program: Strengthening civic values through religious institutions and the police in Indonesia, which is implemented by The Asia Foundation. This specific project aims to further and consolidate democracy and human rights in Indonesia within the period of 2012 to 2013. The program is a joint-effort between The Asia Foundation (TAF) and Paramadina University. It consists of two immediate objectives: 1) To increase public support for women´s participation in public life. 2) To support the ability of the Indonesian police to protect religious freedom and reduce religious tolerance. The target groups of the program include police leaders in conflict areas, the lecturers of the National Police academy (AKPOL) and lectures and students of the universities targeted for seminars. Furthermore a secondary target group will include all citizens, particularly women and minority groups, within selected target communities.
